availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry R. Willett (Prairie City, IL, 2nd Lieut. 5th Ky. Inf. )

body.p: New York native. Married to Elizabeth A. Willett. Father of Charles Frank Willett, Stephen Paul Willett, and Maude Willett. Resident in Prairie City, Illinois, in 1860. Employed William Willett as a clerk in Prairie City in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private, sergeant major, and second lieutenant from September 9, 1861, to June 12, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, McDonough County, Prairie City, p. 471.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Knox County, Galesburg, p. 120A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 201.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #356569, Certificate #332683.
